channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024050033
item.description:
Report E-2024050033

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail impacting the trailer floor that had been crushed by other freight. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent absorbents. The recovered material was containerized into one (1) 10-gallon poly drums. The damaged 5-gallon pail was placed into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050030
item.description:
Report E-2024050030

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from five (5) 1-gallon metal pails due to falling freight. The terminal personnel deployed granular absorbents and cleaned up the released material. The recovered material was containerized into two (2) 5-gallon metal pails. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050026
item.description:
Report E-2024050026

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN1823 Caustic Soda Pearls release from a 50-pound poly bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 pound of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged bag, impacted shrink wrap, and PPE were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

  • Description: 157-34721562 ORD/DXB Total 9 Pcs/ 894.5 Kgs Shipment was not booked as RBI and shipment is booked on QR726/02MAY2024, a passenger aircraft and it was tendered at Qatar Airways facility. Also the commodity in MAWB indicated"Consolidation" without any lithium battery statement. Cargo piece is on hold at the Qatar Airways Cargo facility and advised Shipper of undeclared battery in MAWB. Shipper is picking up 2pcs out of 9 with the same HAWB with the RBI UN3480.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 30110
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During a CHP scale inspection the affected tote was observed"leaking" by CHP. Our driver was isolated from the trailers and was unable to provide any detail except for the attached picture. The discharge from the leak amounted to aboutl gallon which all remained within the confines of trailer Vl 157S. A Clean Harbors technician stated later the leak came from a small fracture on the bladder bag but he was unable to determine if it was caused by: Fatigue Overpressure/Over filling Age handling(including securement)

  • City: Boston
  • State: MA

  • Description: ? Flight 589- Upon landing I met the aircraft ? FAs stated that the passenger in 30C was now fine and that it was a quick event ? He walked off the plane unassisted and thanked the FAs ? Also of concern on this flight, passenger Calvin Lee George seated in 1A reported to the purser that his laptop was very hot and overheating ? FAs followed procedure and placed the laptop into the thermal containment bag and locked it in the aft Iav ? FAs reported this to the pilots and both MX and CS were at the plane to retrieve the bag ^ ? The laptop was not smoking or on fire, but very hot ? Laptop was returned to passenger after deplaning and MX brought a new thermal containment bag for the next departure CALVIN LEE GEORGE Email: Cgeorge1231@gmail.comEmail: Phone 307-258-4504

  • City: Dulles
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: ? IFS CSR Lead met the flight upon arrival/ ? Pax Sean Allen Anderson in seat 29D had his electronic cigarette in his pocket.. ? Pax Anderson notified FA that his electronic cigarette is smoking and starting to burn up and handed to him willingly. ? FA took the electronic cigarette from Pax Anderson and informed the rest of the crew to retrieve the TCB. ? FA stated they saw a clear liquid starting to come from the electronic cigarette. ?FA conduct TCB SOP procedures. ? TCB was stowed in aft left Iavatory. Lavatory was closed and closely monitored for the remainder of the flight. ? TCB was used and no other fire equipment was used. ? No injuries were present and no medical equipment was used.

  • Description: During the boarding process, iPhone 14 ProMax appeared to be warm and was overheating. The screen on the phone appeared to have moisture and was steaming. When HNLCS Gate Lead contacted Operations, I contacted Tech Ops Leadership for a Thermal Containment Bag (TCB). The reason why a TCB was not used from the aircraft was to ensure the aircraft has the sufficient amount of TCB onboard Nose 3138/ Tail N13138. The phone has been placed into the TCB and will be stored in the HNLCS Yellow Hazmat Cabinet which is located behind the East Section of United Airlines Lobby 8, HNLCS offices.

  • Description: Our truck was hauling a load of EAF dust from Nucor Crawfordsville, IN to deliver to WSP, Logansport, IN. He was traveling westbound on CR 225. Another truck traveling eastbound on CR 225 was driving in the center of the road and ran our driver off the road, and then left the scene of the accident. When our truck was run off the road, the truck and trailer overturned onto the passenger's side in a ditch. Upon contact with the ground, the trailer body split and the manways on the roof came open released EAF Dust onto the ground. *Included is a copy of the police report which includes a statement from a witness who saw it happen.

item.title: Report I-2024050007
item.description:
Report I-2024050007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: Seattle
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: WORLDWIDE FLIGHT SERVICES INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: "11 packages were discovered in KSEA containing the following statement"Hazmat- Surface Transportation Only, Restricted E/ectronic Device." These 11 packages(see image below) did not include any of the DG markings or labels we train associates to detect(per ROC), but WFS nonetheless spotted and sidelined them. Had the packages not been sidelined, they would have been loaded onto ATI flight ATN3313(KSEA-PANC). The packages were non-AFN cargo, tendered and packaged by the shipper, Pitney Bowes. The sidelined packages in KSEA were opened to determine the exact content/product. All 11 of them contained Section Il lithium batteries in equipment, such as an ear cleaner, headsets, desk lamp, diving lamp. Of the 11, three were not labeled correctly: they contained rriultiple battery powered products, exceeding the two battery cell allowance for labeling exception. As a result, we consider these three packages to be undeclared DG, despite that they were not ultimately flown. Additionally, five of the 11 packages were packaged incorrectly: they were in a poly bag, not the corrugate box required by IATA PI 967/970. In terms of DOT reporting, per § 171.16"

item.description:
Report E-2024050019

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: ARCOLA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 20ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and 3ft-by-3ft area of the concrete dock and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Hepaco personnel stated that terminal personnel deployed granular absorbents prior to their arrival. Additional granular absorbents were deployed by the contractor. The spent material was recovered and placed into three (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1 OF THE LIDS WASNT SECURED FOR TRANSPORTATION CAUSING SOME OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK OUT. HAZMAT WAS FOUND PILED UNDER NC'S AT THE BACK OF TRAILER 807063. PACKAGE DID NOT SHOW ANY SIGNS OF BEING CRUSHED FROM NC'S BUT WAS NOT PROPERLY LOADED INTO THE TRAILER AND WAS LAYING ON ITS SIDE. CORROSIVE LIQUID SPILT FROM CONTAINER AND LEAKED ONTO AN ALTERNATE PACKAGE (273866476870) ALTERNATE PACKAGE DID NOT HAVE ANY DAMAGE TO THE CONTENTS INSIDE AND SHOWED ONLY DAMAGE TO THE EXTERIOR OF THE PACKAGE FROM THE CORROSIVE LIQUID.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that ten (10) gallons of material was released due to pinhole puncture on one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Clean Harbors personnel stated that Dayton Freight terminal personnel deployed granular absorbents prior to their arrival. Clean Harbors personnel deployed additional absorbents and transferred the remaining material from the damaged tote to a new tote. The spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The empty poly tote and generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040178
item.description:
Report E-2024040178

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/3/2024, at 16:54 hours, personnel in the CSXT Montgomery, AL Yard discovered TJRX 30025, a residue tank car that last contained Petroleum Distillates, NOS leaking from the bottom of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Gardner Asphalt, was notified via CHEMTREC (report 1395529). Marion Environmental, Inc. (MEI), a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and product leaking from the bottom outlet valve (BOV) with the valve in the closed position. MEI personnel actuated the valve between closed and open positions multiple times; once the valve was fully reclosed the release stopped. Upon further inspection, it was noted that the gasket in the bottom outlet valve cap was worn. Additionally, pieced of debris and corrosion were observed in the cap. It is suspected that corrosion and debris present in the valve seat were the cause for product flow through the valve in the closed position. Response personnel installed a new BOV cap gasket and secured the car for transportation. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Duane Thomas, 443-875-4818).

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with visible wet conditions and torn. Upon inspection 4 bottles were discovered of which 2 had no visible damage and the other 2 had some internal leakage. Out of the 2 that leaked out 1 had only about a cup left of solution in the bottle, the other one had only spilled about 2 cups and had majority of the solution. Both bottles had loose caps causing the spillage. The package failure was due to the bottles having loose caps and seals causing internal leakage during the unloading phase. I recommend for better closures for the plastic bottles.

item.title: Report E-2024050000
item.description:
Report E-2024050000

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN1719 Pentrate Ultra Liquid release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the pallet and trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Kolor-Safe was then deployed to clean and neutralize the release. The impacted pallet and absorbents were containerized into a second 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: Large fully regulated hazmat containing 4 plastic one gallon of chlorine oxidizer. The box was wet on the bottom from one of the gallons having a large crack from the top to the bottom, spilling all of liquid inside. Stained other hazmat's as well and are not safe to transport. Hazmat was processed in the unload area and then was called out from the loading area as a damage. Hazmat seems to not have been handled carefully as it was being moved to be loaded. Also, shipper did not contain enough inner packaging to help hazmat as well.

The puncture came from a nail in a pallet and resulted in an estimated 5-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 5’x5’ area. A Contractor cleaned-up the release and overpacked the damaged drum. One drum of waste was generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.description:
Report E-2024040680

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: LEHIGHTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2in-by-15ft area of the trailer floor and 10ft-by-5ft area of the concrete terminal dock and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to a damaged 55-gallon poly drum. Enviroserve personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and used absorbent pads to gather the spent material. The recovered absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was emptied into two (2) 30-gallon poly drums and the damaged 55-gallon was over-packed into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental (GME) to remediate the impacted site. GME personnel utilized rags to remediate the impacted area. The crew then overpacked the two (2) damaged drums in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 15-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for disposal.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: MEMPHIS

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NMP experienced a UN1760 Clothesline Fresh Bult Laundry Detergent 2 release from (2) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2.5-gallons of product released from two pails due to damage caused by improper loading. The release impacted a 3’ x 12’ area of the trailer floor. The damaged pails were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Acid gator was then deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted trailer floor. All impacted absorbents and PPE were containerized into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Upon inspection, 1 of 4 plastic bottles was found with a loose cap causing about 1/2 cup of solution to leak out and soil the outer packaging. Box and label soiled due to leakage.   • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon jug of sodium hydroxide was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel collected the damaged jug and deployed absorbents to the release. The crew worked them in with hand tools and further utilized neutralizing agent and absorbent pads to further remediate the area. All UN1824 impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum and two (2) 15-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, four (4) 50-pound bags of UN3260 were torn during loading and released approximately three (3) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the UN3260-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged onsite for transport and disposal.

  • Description: The CMTV was travelling east on Central Pike. It drove off the right side of the roadway, overcorrected, and then skidded across the center line and overturned onto its side. The CMTV skidded off the roadway through a fence and trees coming to a final rest in the field facing west. During the rollover the force of impact caused the manway failure. Approximately 2,000 lbs. of emulsion spilled from the tank onto the ground. A hazardous materials contractor recovered the spilled emulsion and remediated the soil.

item.title: Report E-2024040117
item.description:
Report E-2024040117

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: IRON MOUNTAIN
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AUSTIN POWDER COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 35025
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 6:55 am on 3/8/2024, Austin Powder drive was 4 miles south of Bismark MO at the intersect of N and NN. He was negotiating a lefthand turn driving a 2019 KW T880, loaded with AN emulsion, and diesel fuel for manufacturing bulk products. The drive swung too wide on a left hand turn and his passenger side went off the pavement. The driver slowed to an almost stop. The passenger side of the truck got stuck in the soft dirt and fell on its side. 20 pounds of AN spilled from one of the bins onto the ground. Roughly 50 gallons of offroad diesel spilled from the truck as well. The truck was put upright, and the AN spill was cleaned up and put into spill buckets and removed from the site. The diesel spill was contained using socks and booms. An environmental company came and removed the affected area at a later date.

  • City: ORANGE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: John Houle, 151 Operation Supervisor, advised Safety of a UN1133, Adhesives, 3, PG II spill on the trailer floor. John stated Curtis Baker was unloading the trailer when a box fell off the pallet causing the spill. Safety advised John that Cura will be called for remediation. Safety reviewed the pho tos showing the LTD QTY labels on the pallet behind the spill and called John back to confirm what spilled in the trailer before contacting CURA. John confirmed it was UN1133.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-23
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE CHUNKS COOLING BIOLOGICAL SAMPLES. THERE ARE NO VISIBLE DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THERE ARE AREAS ON THE BOX THAT HAVE BEEN MARKED OUT WITH BLACK MARKER. ADDITIONALLY, THERE ARE UNKNOWN LABELS THAT HAVE BEEN MOSTLY REMOVED FROM THE OUTER BOX. THE THERMAL LABEL SHIPPER CONTACT NAME ON THE PACKAGE IS PHRINA TRAN.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON THE SEND AGAIN TRAILER. BOTTOM OF PACKAGE SHOWES SIGNS OF AN INTERNAL LEAK. UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND THAT THE GALLON OF HYDROGEN PEROXIDE WAS PACKAGED INSIDE OF A BAG. UPON A CLOSER INSPECTION THE CONTAINER OF HYDROGEN OF PEROXIDE HAD A LOT OF MOISTURE ON IT. COULD NOT FIND A SOURCE OF THE LEAK. THERE WERE NO VISIBLE CRACKS, DENTS, OR HOLES ON THE CONTAINER OF THE HYDROGEN PEROXIDE. THE CAP WAS NOT LOOSE.

Package failure seems to be caused by being dropped causing solution to leak out.

item.description:
Report X-2024041321

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-22
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, USA CBP IMPORT OFFICIALS STOPPED A PACKAGE FROM TAIWAN FOR INSPECTION. THE INVOICE AND THERMAL TRACKING LABEL DESCRIBE THE CONTENTS AS STORAGE BOTTLES. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TEN INNER BOXES DESCRIBING CONTENTS AS KING GUARD SELF-DEFENSIVE BODY PROTECT AEROSOL TYPE AND CONTENTS UNDER PRESSURE. CONTENT INSPECTION OF THESE INNER BOXES REVEALS A TOTAL OF 100 AEROSOL CANS OF SELF DEFENSE KEYCHAIN-STYLE PEPPER SPRAY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report E-2024040617
item.description:
Report E-2024040617

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged by a load shift and released approximately four (4) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel overpacked the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the release. All spent absorbents were placed in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal. All undamaged pails were overpacked in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024040620
item.description:
Report E-2024040620

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of adhesive was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. ES&H personnel began remediation by patching the hole of the damaged drum and placing it into one (1) overpack. The dry adhesive was scraped off the floor, then absorbents were placed on the impacted area. All spent absorbents, and adhesive were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040619
item.description:
Report E-2024040619

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, two (2) 55-gallon drums of acetone were damaged due to a pallet failure in transit. Due to the damage, the drums released approximately ten (10) gallons of acetone to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel collected two (2) damaged drums and placed them in 85-gallon overpack for potential reuse. Crews then deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor and worked them in utilizing hand tools. Once collected, TLE personnel utilized a degreasing agent and absorbent pads to collect any residual product. All acetone impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum and RLC personnel took possession of all three (3) drums to be added to the facility waste stream.

  • Description: On April 12, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of chromium trioxide anhydrous were crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. The two (2) damaged 5-gallon pails were over-packed into two separate 55-gallon drums. MSES personnel deployed granular absorbents and neutralizer to the chromium trioxide anhydrous-impacted roadway and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024100036
item.description:
Report I-2024100036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T00:36:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: FAIRVIEW
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: WASTE MANAGEMENT OF NEW JERSEY, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 5, 2023, a Waste Management of New Jersey, Inc. truck inadvertently transported a container that contained several boxes with containers of plastic hand sanitizer bottles to the Waste Management of New Jersey, Inc. Fairview Solid Waste Facility Transfer Station / Material Recovery Facility in Fairview, NJ. The origin location of the hand sanitizer is Pocas International, 19 Central Blvd, South Hackensack, NJ. The container was tipped onto the solid waste transfer station tip floor and upon discovery, the WMNJI Fairview Transfer Station personnel shut down the tipping floor to secure the area. The New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection was notified and NJDEP incident ID# 23-12-05-1711-50 was assigned. The material was then re-packaged by a third party company (Whitman) into the appropriate containers, labeled, secured in a safe area at the facility for ultimate transportation to the appropriate facility for recycling or disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024100035
item.description:
Report I-2024100035

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T00:36:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: BYERS
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PLAINS MARKETING GP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 168184
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 29, 2023 at approximately 9:57 AM, a Plains transport driver with a load of crude oil was traveling southbound on NW 70th St near Byers in Pratt County, KS to Plains Wellsford Station east of Wellsford, KS. The driver ran off the roadway (right) onto the earthen shoulder, went to correct to enter back onto roadway (left) when trailer turned sideways and with momentum laid over onto its side. Upon landing on its side a seam on the trailer body was punctured, creating a small hole and as result 14 gallons of crude oil was released onto the roadway and into the roadside ditch. The transport vehicle was non drivable and had to be towed from the scene. The roadway was cleaned and impacted roadside ditch was excavated to remove impacted soil and area graded to restore contouring. The Plains driver was injured and treated at Hutchison Regional Medical Center in Hutchison, KS.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-30T18:16:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD C. THE UNLOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 3 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE CAPS ON THE INNER 5 LITER PLASTIC CONTAINERS WERE LOOSE BY 1/4 OF A TURN AND 2 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED FROM ONE OF THEM ONTO THE OUTER CARTON WHICH WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX.

WHEN PACKAGE WAS OPENED TO SEE WHETHER THE CONTENTS WERE SALVAGEABLE FOR A REWRAP OR IF THEY HAD BEEN DAMAGED THE BAG OF ALGAECIDE WAS SEEN. IT HAD AN OXIDIZER DIAMOND AND THE UN NUMBER UN3378 PRINTED ONTO THE BAG ALONG WITH OTHER DANGER MARKINGS. INSIDE THE BOX WERE SMALL WHITE GRANULES THAT HAD COME OUT OF THE BAG. THEY DID NOT EVERY LEAK ANYWHERE OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGING, BUT THE BAG IS DAMAGED.

item.title: Report X-2024041234
item.description:
Report X-2024041234

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-30T18:16:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND PRODUCING A PUDDLE FROM SPILLAGE BY THE SWEEPER IN UNLOAD-C AT DOOR 27. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED AND A 2' PUDDLE OF LIQUID NEUTRALIZED CLEANED UP, THEN ALL AFFECTED MATERIALS WERE TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THERE WAS A CRACK ON THE SIDE OF 1 OF 4 POLY, 1-GAL JUGS. THE INNER PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF A CORRUGATED DIVIDER AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOPX RATED AT A 350 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.

  • City: CAROL STREAM

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Fully regulated hazmat containing a plastic gallon of chlorine oxidizer. The box was wet and had strong fumes coming out from the gallon having a large crack on the body and spilling all of liquid. We mistakenly added foam neutralizer to try and contain the spill, but the chemicals reacted that caused box to get hot. Immediately showered it with water to contain it from getting worse and eventually cooled it down. Placed it inside a plastic drum as soon as it was good enough to touch, sealed it with double bag and zip ties. Did not want to open again to re examine for safety concerns.

CHEMICAL UNDER PRESSURE, N.O.S., (HYDROFLUOROOLEFIN NITROGEN) INNER BOX MARKED AND LABELED WITH HAZMAT SHIPPING PAPERS, PSN AND DOT LABELS; NET WEIGHT OF CYLINDER 29.3 LBS AND GROSS WEIGHT 40.2 LBS. PACKAGE WEIGHT ON THERMAL STATES 41 LBS. THE ACTUAL PACKAGE WEIGHT IS 82 LBS.

item.title: Report X-2024041240
item.description:
Report X-2024041240

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-30T18:16:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: SOUTH BEND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THERE WAS A FOUND PACKAGE WHERE THE CONTENTS APPEARED TO BE DAMAGED. THE UNLOAD SUPERVISOR CALLED FOR A RESPONDER AND MADE HIS WAY BACK TO THE PRIMARY UNLOAD TO RESPOND TO THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED IN TRAILER. DONNED PROPER PPE, FOLLOW THE DECISION TREE, AND REMOVED THE PACKAGE FROM THE TRAILER TO OUR DMP AREA. RESPONDER PROCEEDED TO CALL THE FT RMP FOR THE SORT, TO LET HIM KNOW ABOUT THE UNKOWN LEAKER. AFTER THE SORT, WHEN ENTERING THE PACKAGE INTO ETT AS A DAMAGE, WE OPENED IT TO FIND A DAMAGED/LEAKING BATTERY. UPON LOOKING UP THE SDS, IT SHOULD HAVE BEEN REGULATED AND SCBA DONNED. THIS IS WHEN FT RMP CALLED THE UPS HAZMAT HELP DESK, AND WE ENTERED AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT INTO ETT. AN OUTSIDE RESPONDER HAD TO BE CALLED TO RESPOND TO THIS PACKAGE SINCE RESPONDER DID NOT HAVE PROPER PPE TO DMP THE PACKAGE.

Approximately 1 gallon was released. E3 Environmental responded to the scene and assisted with transferring the product into a another trailer and remediating the spill.
